title.value: Recommended Immunizations Order Set

display.value: Adult patients in any clinical setting (ambulatory, inpatient, etc.), including employees of the VA who are treated as patients of the VA.

title.value: Hepatitis B Vaccine Series (0, 1, and 6 Months) for Age >= 20 Years

description.value: Adults in the following settings are assumed to be at risk for hepatitis B virus infection and should receive a HepB series: sexually transmitted disease treatment facilities, HIV testing and treatment facilities, facilities providing drug-abuse treatment and prevention services, healthcare settings targeting services to persons who inject drugs, correctional facilities, healthcare settings targeting services to men who have sex with men, hemodialysis facilities and end-stage renal disease programs, and institutions and nonresidential day care facilities for developmentally disabled persons

title.value: Meningococcal Immunizations

description.value: Meningococcal vaccines should be used during pregnancy only if clearly needed. Health care providers are encouraged to register women who receive a meningococcal vaccine during pregnancy. See package inserts at: https://www.fda.gov/BiologicsBloodVaccines/Vaccines/ApprovedProducts/default.htm.

title.value: Serogroups A, C, W, and Y Conjugate Vaccine (MenACWY) Series and Boosters

title.value: Pneumococcal Immunization

description.value: Pneumococcal Immunization CDC guidelines https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/vpd/pneumo/hcp/recommendations.html. Both Pneumococcal Polysaccharide Vaccine (PPSV23) and Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine (PCV13) should be given to a pregnant woman only if clearly needed. Pregnancy is not an absolute contraindication.
